definitions.definition: The act or process of decelerating .
examples: The rocket is now in deceleration .

definitions.definition: The amount by which a speed or velocity decreases (and so a scalar quantity or a vector quantity ), an acceleration having a negative numerical value .
examples: The brakes produce a deceleration of 10 metres per second.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The act or process of decelerating .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) The amount by which a speed or velocity decreases (and so a scalar quantity or a vector quantity ), an acceleration having a negative numerical value .
